isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - DISASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Mount the auxiliary section in a vise with brass jaw protectors.

If the auxiliary countershafts, countershaft bearings, bearing races, bearing shims, auxiliary section housing, and main case will be re-used, remove one of the countershaft bearing covers and mark the parts as upper shaft or lower shaft ( Figure 77). Then if the countershafts are reassembled with all parts in their original positions, the original shims can be re-used, and reshimming will not be required.

If not previously removed, remove the output yoke nut and output yoke. To remove the nut, use a large air impact wrench or a breaker bar and a 70 mm or 2-3/4 inch socket. To prevent the output shaft from turning, place a shop rag in the gear mesh. If necessary, use a yoke puller to remove the yoke.

Mark the output bearing cover and the rear of the housing in such a way that you will know what position to install the bearing cover in later. The cover can be installed in two opposite positions ( Figure 77).
Remove the speedometer rotor/seal sleeve ( Figure 77).
Remove the O-ring from the output shaft.

warning.para: As you move the output shaft forward, the auxiliary countershafts may fall out of the auxiliary section housing causing personal injury or damage to the countershafts.

step1.para: Use a maul to move the output shaft forward far enough to remove the auxiliary countershafts ( Figure 78).
Remove the range synchronizer assembly and range yoke assembly from the output shaft.
Continue moving the output shaft assembly forward until it is free of the auxiliary section housing.
Remove the four (4) bolts from each of the auxiliary housing countershaft rear bearing covers ( Figure 79).
Remove the auxiliary countershaft rear bearing cover, gasket, and shim from each auxiliary countershaft (Figure 79).
Remove the auxiliary countershaft bearing races.
Remove the bolts securing the lock cover to the auxiliary housing ( Figure 79).
Remove the lock cover and remove the O-ring from the cover ( Figure 79).
Remove the output bearing retaining bolts and cover from the auxiliary housing ( Figure 80).
To remove the output seal, drive the seal out the rear of the output bearing cover with a hammer and drift.
Remove the output bearing and bearing cup.
